direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods reset a position (read or write) to zero, affecting the state of the buffer similarly.
Both methods modify the write position and affect the buffer's state, though in different ways.
Both methods modify the buffer's state by changing positions, though they target different positions (read vs. write).
Both methods involve modifying the buffer's internal state, though setCapacity focuses on resizing the buffer.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the buffer with a specific size can set up the initial state required for testing resetWritePosition.
Writing data to the buffer can set up the write position and buffered data required for testing resetWritePosition.
Checking the remaining write space can verify the effect of resetWritePosition on the buffer's state.
